t: Psalm 22
The Suffering, Praise, and Posterity of the Messiah
To the Chief Musician. Set to “The Deer of the Dawn.” A Psalm of David.
My*pn God, My God, why have You forsaken Me? Why*ild are*i You*i so*i far from helping Me, And*ild from*i the words of My groaning?
O*ld My God, I cry in the daytime, but You do not hear; And*ld in the night season, and am not silent.
But*ln You are*i holy, Enthroned*ld in the praises of Israel.
Our*ld fathers trusted in You; They*ld trusted, and You delivered them.
They*ld cried to You, and were delivered; They*ld trusted in You, and were not ashamed.
But*ln I am*i a worm, and no man; A*ld reproach of men, and despised by the people.
All*ld those who see Me ridicule Me; They*ld shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,*i
“He*ld trusted in the Lord,*s let Him rescue Him; Let*ld Him deliver Him, since He delights in Him!”
But*ln You are*i He who took Me out of the womb; You*ld made Me trust while*i on My mother’s breasts.
I*ld was cast upon You from birth. From*ld My mother’s womb You*ld have*i been*i My God.
Be*ld not far from Me, For*ld trouble is*i near; For*ld there*i is*i none to help.
Many*ln bulls have surrounded Me; Strong*ld bulls*i of Bashan have encircled Me.
They*ld gape at Me with*i their mouths, Like*ild a raging and roaring lion.
I*ln am poured out like water, And*ld all My bones are out of joint; My*ld heart is like wax; It*ld has melted within Me.
My*ld strength is dried up like a potsherd, And*ld My tongue clings to My jaws; You*ld have brought Me to the dust of death.
For*ln dogs have surrounded Me; The*ld congregation of the wicked has enclosed Me. They*ld pierced My hands and My feet;
I*ld can count all My bones. They*ld look and*i stare at Me.
They*ld divide My garments among them, And*ld for My clothing they cast lots.
But*ln You, O Lord,*s do not be far from Me; O*ld My Strength, hasten to help Me!
Deliver*ld Me from the sword, My*ld precious life*i from the power of the dog.
Save*ld Me from the lion’s mouth And*ld from the horns of the wild oxen! You*ln have answered Me.
I*ln will declare Your name to My brethren; In*ld the midst of the assembly I will praise You.
You*ld who fear the Lord,*s praise Him! All*ld you descendants of Jacob, glorify Him, And*ld fear Him, all you offspring of Israel!
For*ld He has not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; Nor*ld has He hidden His face from Him; But*ld when He cried to Him, He heard.
My*ln praise shall*i be*i of You in the great assembly; I*ld will pay My vows before those who fear Him.
The*ld poor shall eat and be satisfied; Those*ld who seek Him will praise the Lord.*s Let*ld your heart live forever!
All*ln the ends of the world Shall*ld remember and turn to the Lord,*s And*ld all the families of the nations Shall*ld worship before You.
For*ld the kingdom is*i the Lord*s ’s, And*ld He rules over the nations.
All*ln the prosperous of the earth Shall*ld eat and worship; All*ld those who go down to the dust Shall*ld bow before Him, Even*ld he who cannot keep himself alive.
A*ln posterity shall serve Him. It*ld will be recounted of the Lord to the next*i generation,
They*ld will come and declare His righteousness to a people who will be born, That*ld He has done this.*i
